page.title: 14HOUSING IN RAWMARSH
page.content: On one of our Domesday visits we met Mrs. Hawkins who lives next to the corner shop on Barber's Avenue. She has lived there since 1926 so she has lived in Rawmarsh for 59 years. She told us about what Rawmarsh was like many years ago. All the houses had outside toilets so old people in winter would have to get all wrapped up to go to the toilet. They used to have baths on legs which they stood in front of the fire in the front room. The houses are different now, some of them are being re-built. The builders repair the plaster, replace doors and windows and they are allowed to put two new outside doors on every house. The houses now have central heating. They are more comfortable than they were in 1926.
